    WARNING: Internal class, subject to change in future versions.

    • Method Detail

      • create

        public Host.CreateInvocation create(HostTypes.CreateSpec spec)
        Description copied from interface: Host
        Add a new standalone host in the vCenter inventory. The newly connected host will be in connected state. The vCenter Server will verify the SSL certificate before adding the host to its inventory. In the case where the SSL certificate cannot be verified because the Certificate Authority is not recognized or the certificate is self signed, the vCenter Server will fall back to thumbprint verification mode as defined by HostTypes.CreateSpec.ThumbprintVerification.

        Invocation Result:
        The newly created identifier of the host in vCenter. The return value will be an identifier for the resource type: HostSystem.

        Operation Errors:
        AlreadyExists - if the host with the same name is already present.
        Error - if installation of VirtualCenter agent on a host fails.
        Error - if the system reports an error while responding to the request.
        InvalidArgument - if the host name is invalid.
        InvalidArgument - if the host folder is invalid.
        InvalidArgument - if the SSL thumbprint specified is invalid.
        InvalidElementType - if the host folder id does not support vSphere compute resource as its children type.
        NotFound - if there is no folder associated with the getFolder() property in the system.
        ResourceInUse - if the host is already being managed by another vCenter Server
        UnableToAllocateResource - if there are not enough licenses to add the host.
        Unauthenticated - if the user name or password for the administration account on the host are invalid.
        Unauthenticated - if the user can not be authenticated.
        Unsupported - if the software version on the host is not supported.
        ServiceUnavailable - if the system is unable to communicate with a service to complete the request.
        Unauthorized - if the user doesn't have the required privileges.

        Specified by:
        create in interface Host
        Parameters:
        spec - Specification for the new host to be created.
        Returns:
        instance of Host.CreateInvocation which upon invoke executes the above described create operation. The operation result or the operation error will be stored in the CompletionStageFuture that invoke returns.

      • delete

        public Host.DeleteInvocation delete(java.lang.String host)
        Description copied from interface: Host
        Remove a standalone host from the vCenter Server.

        Operation Errors:
        Error - if the system reports an error while responding to the request.
        NotFound - if there is no host associated with host in the system.
        ResourceInUse - if the host associated with host is in a vCenter cluster
        ServiceUnavailable - if the system is unable to communicate with a service to complete the request.
        Unauthenticated - if the user can not be authenticated.
        Unauthorized - if the user doesn't have the required privileges.

        Specified by:
        delete in interface Host
        Parameters:
        host - Identifier of the host to be deleted. The parameter must be an identifier for the resource type: HostSystem.
        Returns:
        instance of Host.DeleteInvocation which upon invoke executes the above described delete operation. The operation result or the operation error will be stored in the CompletionStageFuture that invoke returns.

      • list

        public Host.ListInvocation list()
        Description copied from interface: Host
        Returns information about at most 2500 visible (subject to permission checks) hosts in vCenter matching the HostTypes.FilterSpec.

        Invocation Result:
        Commonly used information about the hosts matching the HostTypes.FilterSpec.

        Operation Errors:
        InvalidArgument - if the HostTypes.FilterSpec.getConnectionStates() property contains a value that is not supported by the server.
        UnableToAllocateResource - if more than 2500 hosts match the HostTypes.FilterSpec.
        ServiceUnavailable - if the system is unable to communicate with a service to complete the request.
        Unauthenticated - if the user can not be authenticated.
        Unauthorized - if the user doesn't have the required privileges.

        Specified by:
        list in interface Host
        Returns:
        instance of Host.ListInvocation which upon invoke executes the above described list operation. The operation result or the operation error will be stored in the CompletionStageFuture that invoke returns.

      • connect

        public Host.ConnectInvocation connect(java.lang.String host)
        Description copied from interface: Host
        Connect to the host corresponding to host previously added to the vCenter server.

        Operation Errors:
        AlreadyInDesiredState - if the host associated with host is already connected.
        Error - if the system reports an error while responding to the request.
        NotFound - if there is no host associated with host in the system.
        ServiceUnavailable - if the system is unable to communicate with a service to complete the request.
        Unauthenticated - if the user can not be authenticated.
        Unauthorized - if the user doesn't have the required privileges.

        Specified by:
        connect in interface Host
        Parameters:
        host - Identifier of the host to be reconnected. The parameter must be an identifier for the resource type: HostSystem.
        Returns:
        instance of Host.ConnectInvocation which upon invoke executes the above described connect operation. The operation result or the operation error will be stored in the CompletionStageFuture that invoke returns.

      • disconnect

        public Host.DisconnectInvocation disconnect(java.lang.String host)
        Description copied from interface: Host
        Disconnect the host corresponding to host from the vCenter server

        Operation Errors:
        AlreadyInDesiredState - if the host associated with host is already disconnected.
        Error - if the system reports an error while responding to the request.
        NotFound - if there is no host associated with host in the system.
        ServiceUnavailable - if the system is unable to communicate with a service to complete the request.
        Unauthenticated - if the user can not be authenticated.
        Unauthorized - if the user doesn't have the required privileges.

        Specified by:
        disconnect in interface Host
        Parameters:
        host - Identifier of the host to be disconnected. The parameter must be an identifier for the resource type: HostSystem.
        Returns:
        instance of Host.DisconnectInvocation which upon invoke executes the above described disconnect operation. The operation result or the operation error will be stored in the CompletionStageFuture that invoke returns.
